update.description:
First pass at integration. Currently it just builds a sample scene for demo purposes, and publishes images over ign transport.

![gazebo-ign-rendering.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/baqryA7/images/369353022-gazebo-ign-rendering.png)

try out the demo by running:

~~~
GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH IGN_GUI_PLUGIN_PATH=src/gui gazebo
~~~
update.title: Integrate ign rendering

content.raw: in a separate PR
content.html: in a separate PR

content.html: added. 6e8a3a8

content.raw: this function is misleading. I've changed it to `LoadEngine`. Currently each engine will create it's own scene and there is an ignition-rendering [demo](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/1f2de75f5bc037efd64f00770d76592bb807cfad/examples/gazebo_scene_viewer/?at=default) that shows using scene managers to manage updates to different engines' scene. The plan is to have a shared scene tree data but that's still to be done.
content.html: this function is misleading. I've changed it to LoadEngine. Currently each engine will create it's own scene and there is an ignition-rendering demo that shows using scene managers to manage updates to different engines' scene. The plan is to have a shared scene tree data but that's still to be done.

content.raw: done. bcc7e75
content.html: done. bcc7e75

content.raw: ya, I'll work on that next
content.html: ya, I'll work on that next

content.raw: We should add the new dependency to the README
content.html: We should add the new dependency to the README

content.raw: I see, thanks for the clarification. I still need to wrap my head around what the final product will look like :)
content.html: I see, thanks for the clarification. I still need to wrap my head around what the final product will look like :)

content.raw: Not for systems. Since `include` gets installed, headers there should be subject to the tick-tock cycle. I don't think there's a need to inherit from a system, and not installing makes it easier to do bug fixes post-release.
content.html: Not for systems. Since include gets installed, headers there should be subject to the tick-tock cycle. I don't think there's a need to inherit from a system, and not installing makes it easier to do bug fixes post-release.

content.raw: Since this demo is under systems, is there any plan to make use of components within it?
content.html: Since this demo is under systems, is there any plan to make use of components within it?

content.raw: `ignerr`?
content.html: ignerr?

content.raw: Should all headers be in the `include` folder?
content.html: Should all headers be in the include folder?

content.raw: Just a clarification. The scene is independent of the rendering engine, only the camera is?
content.html: Just a clarification. The scene is independent of the rendering engine, only the camera is?

content.raw: Suggestion: consider including more specific headers
content.html: Suggestion: consider including more specific headers

content.raw: ya actually we shouldn't control the framerate based on simulation time. I separated out `updaterate` and `framerate` and added more comments that the throttling is now only for demo purposes. 3d03696
content.html: ya actually we shouldn't control the framerate based on simulation time. I separated out updaterate and framerate and added more comments that the throttling is now only for demo purposes. 3d03696

update.title: Integrate ign rendering

content.raw: Incrementing the render time by the framerate timestep could have adverse effects. If the frame render time is slower than the frame rate, then nextRenderTime will get further and further behind the currentTime. Then, if rendering becomes faster, it will render a huge burst of frames at above-framerate frequency as the discrepancy catches up.
content.html: Incrementing the render time by the framerate timestep could have adverse effects. If the frame render time is slower than the frame rate, then nextRenderTime will get further and further behind the currentTime. Then, if rendering becomes faster, it will render a huge burst of frames at above-framerate frequency as the discrepancy catches up.

content.raw: Is nextRenderTime ever initialized to the current time?
content.html: Is nextRenderTime ever initialized to the current time?

content.raw: This one doesn't get documentation from the base class; there's no `Update()` method on `ecs::System`
content.html: This one doesn't get documentation from the base class; there's no Update() method on ecs::System

content.raw: There's a macro `gz_install_library` that seems to take care of symbolic links with the project version
content.html: There's a macro gz_install_library that seems to take care of symbolic links with the project version
